intro: Huperzia whangshanensis var. rectifolia, commonly known as the straight-leaf clubmoss, is a rare and unique variant of the Huperzia genus. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. This plant is native to specific regions in China, where it thrives in moist, shaded forest environments. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are typically found on the underside of the leaves. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
